faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en:
The course provides basic knowledge in human and medical genetics and an overview of the clinical genetics field.
The course covers genetics of monogenic and chromosomal diseases; developmental genetics; genetics of multifactorial diseases and cancer; broader role and special features of genetics in medicine; molecular diagnostics and screening programmes of genetic diseases, basis of gene therapy; state-of-the art overview of the clinical genetics applications and interactions with other medical disciplines.
description.et:
Kursus annab inimese ja meditsiinigeneetika alusteadmised ning ülevaate kliinilise geneetiku tööst.
Käsitletakse monogeensete ja kromosoomhaiguste geneetikat; arengugeneetikat; multifaktoriaalsete haiguste ja kasvajate geneetikat; geneetika laiemat rolli meditsiinis ja selle eripärasid; molekulaardiagnostika, pärilike haiguste sõeluuringute ja geeniteraapia aluseid; kaasaegseid kliinilise geneetika tööpõhimõtteid ning koostööd teiste meditsiinierialadega.

objectives.en: To obtain an integrated, up-to-date understanding of the key knowledge in medical genetics and overview of the current and perspective applications of genetics in medicine.
objectives.et: Omandada integreeritud ja kaasaegne arusaam meditsiinigeneetika põhialustest, geneetika olulisimatest tänastest ja persepktiivsetest rakendustest meditsiinis.

objectives.en: To obtain basic knowledge in clinical genetics field and its interactions with other medical disciplines.
objectives.et: Omandada alusteadmised kliinilise geneetika valdkonnast ja selle seostest teiste meditsiinierialadega.

learning_outcomes.en: - basic terminology in human and medical genetics
learning_outcomes.et: - oskus kasutada tänapäevaseid inimese ja meditsiinigeneetika põhimõisteid

learning_outcomes.en: - state-of-the art basic knowledge in medical genetics
- knowledge in using online databases in human and medical genetics
learning_outcomes.et: - oskus kasutada tänapäevaseid inimese ja meditsiinigeneetika andmebaase

learning_outcomes.en: - current understanding of medical genetics applications, challenges and ethical aspects
learning_outcomes.et: - kaasaegne arusaam geneetika rakendustest, väljakutsetest ja eetikast meditsiinis

learning_outcomes.en: - an overview of the clinical genetics field, and its role in medicine
learning_outcomes.et: - ülevaade kliinilise geneetiku igapäeva tööst ja üldisemast rollist meditsiinis
2. Edasi arendatud on järgmised üldised võtmepädevused:

learning_outcomes.en: - in putting the obtained knowledge in genetics in a broader context in medicine
learning_outcomes.et: - kursuse käigus omandatud geneetika teadmiste asetamine laiemasse inimese tervisega seotud konteksti

learning_outcomes.en: - in teaming up with fellow students in preparing course homework and during the practical course
learning_outcomes.et: - meeskonna töö võimekuse edasiarendus läbi grupitöö formaadi

learning_outcomes.en: 3. Basic knowledge to follow in future the developments and applications of genetic tools in the chosen medical field
learning_outcomes.et: 3. Baasteadmised, et jälgida tulevikus oma valitud meditsiinierialal geneetika uuringute ja nende rakendusvõimaluste arenguid.

independent_work.et: Throughout the practical course, the students are expected to complete mandatory homework by the set time. Detailed instructions will be sent in advance before the course.

description.et: Completion of homework tasks throughout the seminars and practical course is mandatory. Students will receive detailed instructions for every course day beforehand.
During the course, the students will have to complete several Moodle based tests by the set time.

Final assessment of the course takes place in two independent assessments:
Part 1. Basic human and medical genetics (written test, 4 broader questions on the course topics; each question evaluated at the scale 0-5 points; total max 20 points)
Part 2. Clinical genetics (Moodle-based test, 20 questions, each 1 point; total 20 points).

For a positive exam outcome, the individual score received in BOTH PARTS of the exam has to exceed the threshold of minimum 11 points. 10 points and below is considered as a failure and re-assessment of the respective part of the exam is needed.

The final exam mark (A-F) reflects the combined scores of both parts, with the weight 2/3 for Part 1 (initial points) and 1/3 for Part 2 (initial points divided to 2).
The weighted scale of 0-30 points will correspond to the following marks: 27-30 'A' (threshold 90%); 24-26, 'B' (80%); 21-23 'C (70%)'; 18-20 'D' (60%); 15-17 'E' (50%); and below 15 p. 'F'.

grade_preconditions.et:
1. Mandatory attendance to the practical course.
2. Independent homework and set tasks (e.g. in Moodle or to be presented at the course) positively conducted and presented on-time to the course lecturer.

grade_evaluation.et:
Final assessment of the course materials takes place in two separate tests:
1. Basic human and medical genetics
2. Clinical genetics.

The students have to pass the set threshold in both tests. The final mark reflects the knowledge in both parts of the course with the weight 2/3 for part 1 and 1/3 for part 2.

debt_elimination.et: Toimub vastavalt TÜ õppekorralduseeskirjale kokkuleppel õppejõuga.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.mandatory_materials:
1. Lectures (audio), additional e-learning materials and all practical course materials are in Moodle.

2. Course textbook:
Lynn B. Jorde, John C. Carey, Michael J. Bamshad " Medical Genetics" 6th edition (2019) Elsevier.
Course textbooks are available at the Biomedicum library.
A PDF of the course book's 5th edition (2016) is provided in Moodle.
resources.recommended_materials:
Other recommended excellent textbooks:
(1) Peter Turnpenny, Sian Ellard "Emery's Elements of Medical Genetics" 15th edition (2017) Elsevier
(2) Robert L. Nussbaum, Roderick R. McInnes, Huntington F. Willard "Thompson & Thompson Genetics in Medicine" 8th edition (2016) Elsevier

weeks.et: Loengud; praktikumid/seminarid (1 kord=5 auditoorset tundi) semestri jooksul 15-päevaste tsüklitena

description.et:
Lecture 1 'Genetics of monogenetic diseases I' (Maris Laan) - audio-lectures in Moodle:
- Pedigree analysis to determine the inheritance pattern
- Autosomal dominant/recessive inherited disease
- X-chromosomal dominant/recessive inherited disease
- Y-chromosomal linked medical conditions

Lecture 2 'Genetics of monogenetic diseases II (Maris Laan) - audio-lectures in Moodle:
- Diseases caused by mutations in the mitochondrial genome
- Triplet-repeat expansion disorders'

Lecture 3 'Genome structural variation and chromosomal disorders' (Maris Laan) - audio-lectures in Moodle:
- Gross chromosomal abnormalities
- Submicroscopic structural variants. Microdeletion and microduplication syndromes

Lecture 4 'Genetics of multifactorial diseases' (Triin Laisk) - audio-lectures in Moodle:
- Inheritance of complex diseases and its assessment
- Genetic association testing, including genome-wide association studies
- The knowledge from the research of multifactorial diseases - the contribution to medicine; polygenic risk scores and perspective applications

Lecture 5 'Developmental genetics' (Maris Laan) - audio-lectures in Moodle:
- Importance in medicine, basic terminology and involved pathways, penetrance and pleiotropy
- The basic concepts of early embryonic development 
- Molecular mechanisms of human intrauterine development, the spectrum on developmental genetic defects

Lecture 6 'Cancer genetics' (Maris Laan) - audio-lectures in Moodle:
- Molecular bases of cancer development and specific aspects of cancer genetics; cancer driver genes 
- Familial cancer syndromes
- Sporadic cancers
- Application of oncogenetics in medicine

Practical course day 1 (virtual)
1) Revision of basic terminology in genetics
- learn/revise based on course book and provided materials in Moodle
- complete the Moodle-based test on genetic terminology

2) Homework for the preparation of the course day 2
- read material 'Basics of human genome structure and function'
- listening audio-lectures 'Genetic testing in medicine - brief introduction', 'Genetic variation', 'Monogenic diseases (introduction, autosomal-dominant and -recessive disease, X- and Y-linked diseases, mitochondrial diseases)'
- Assessment of the course book on these topics (chapters 1-5)

3) reading and preparing a presentation based on an scientific article to be handled in practical course days 2-7. Every student has to read and present one scientific article together with a fellow student; articles are pre-selected by the lecturers;the list of articles and more detailed information are provided before the course.

Practical course day 2
1) At the seminar:
- Interactive group-work based seminar on the topics  'Role and specific aspects of genetics in medicine', 'Genetic variation', 'Monogenic diseases'
- lecture and subsequent discussion "Method selection for genetic diagnosis"
- Scientific article presentation by students

2) Homework for the preparation of the course day 3
- Listening audio-lectures "Monogenic diseases, part 6"
- Listening audio-lectures "Chromosomal disorders, parts 1-4"
- Assessment of the course book on these topics (chapter 5)

Practical course day 3
1) at the seminar
- Group-work based assessment of the prepared homework (topics "Monogenic-diseases part 6, Chromosomal disorders").
- Lecture and subsequent discussion "Screening programs for genetic diseases"
- Scientific article presentation by students

2) Homework - preparation for the course day 4:
- Listening audio-lectures "Genetics of multifactorial diseases"
- Assessment of the course book on this topic (chapter 12)

Practical course day 4
1) At the seminar:
- Group-work based assessment of the prepared homework (topic "Genetics of multifactorial diseases")
- Short lecture on "Biobanks and their value in medicine" by lecturer
- Scientific article presentation by students

2) Homework: preparation for the e-learning day 5:
- Revise course materials "Method selection for genetic diagnosis" (PDF)
- Assessment of the course book on this topic (chapter 3)

Practical course day 5 (virtual)
1) Assessment of the material
- e-lectures "Human genetics databases" (PDF) & "Pharmacogenetics databases" (PDF)
- reading the course book material on pharmacogenetics (ch. 14)
2) Performance of practical exercises and tests in Moodle "Genetics and pharmacogenetics databases test".

3) Homework: preparation for the course day 6:
- Listening audio-lectures "Cancer genetics, parts 1-3"
- Assessment of the course book on these topics (chapters 11).

Practical course day 6
1) At the seminar:
- Summary on the outcome of the Test " Genetics and pharmacogenetics databases test" by lecturer.
- Group-work based assessment of the prepared homework (topic "Cancer genetics").
- Scientific article presentation by students

2) Homework: preparation for the course day 7:
- Listening audio-lectures "Developmental genetics, parts 1-2"
- Assessment of the course book on this topic (chapter 10)

Practical course day 7
1) At the seminar:
- Group-work based assessment of the prepared homework (topic "Developmental genetics").
- Lecture and subsequent discussion "Gene therapy"
- Scientific article presentation by students

2) Homework: 
course book, reading of ch. 13

Practical course day 8: 
preparation for the exam, Part 1 (Basics in human and medical genetics)
Practical course day 9: Exam, part 1- Basics in human and medical genetics

Seminar, day 11: Clinical Genetics
-Examination of a genetic patient
-Panopto lectures

Practical course, day 11: Clinical Genetics
-Examination of a genetic patient/ Dysmorphology assignments

Seminar, day 12: Clinical Genetics
-Ethical, legal, and social aspects of genetic counselling. Legal regulations.
-Panopto lectures

Practical course, day 12: Clinical Genetics
-Examination of a genetic patient/ Dysmorphology assignments

Seminar, day 13: Clinical Genetics
-Hereditary cancer syndromes
-Panopto lectures

Practical course, day 13: Clinical Genetics
-Interpretation of genetic tests in clinical medicine

Seminar, day 14: Clinical Genetics
-Adult-onset genetic disorders
-Panopto lectures

Practical course, day 14: Clinical Genetics
-Treatment of inherited disorders: different possibilities and practice in Estonia
Practical course, day 15: Exam, part 2 - Clinical genetics
